Package de.gnwi.mfsim.model.util

Class StringUtilityMethods

java.lang.Object
de.gnwi.mfsim.model.util.StringUtilityMethods
public class StringUtilityMethods extends Object
String utility methods to be instantiated
Author:
Achim Zielesny

      public String[] splitAndTrim(String aString)
      Splits a string into a string array after one or more whitespace characters.
      Parameters:
      aString - String to split
      Returns:
      A string array containing the trimmed split strings or null if aString was null or empty

      String with globally unique ID
      Returns:

    • formatDoubleValue

      public String formatDoubleValue(String aValueRepresentation, int aNumberOfDecimals)
      Formats a double value to specified number of decimals. NOTE: Double value is correctly rounded to the specified number of decimals.
      Parameters:
      aValueRepresentation - Double value representation
      aNumberOfDecimals - Number of decimals
      Returns:
      Double value representation with specified number of decimals or aValue if no format change is possible

    • formatDoubleValue

      public String formatDoubleValue(double aValue, int aNumberOfDecimals)
      Formats a double value to specified number of decimals. NOTE: Double value is correctly rounded to the specified number of decimals. NOTE: DecimalFormat uses default rounding mode different from mathematical rounding!
      Parameters:
      aValue - Value
      aNumberOfDecimals - Number of decimals
      Returns:
      Double value representation with specified number of decimals

    • startsWithDoubleValue

      public boolean startsWithDoubleValue(String aString)
      True: String starts with a double value, false: Otherwise.
      Parameters:
      aString - String
      Returns:
      True: String starts with a double value, false: Otherwise.

    • isDoubleValue

      public boolean isDoubleValue(String aDoubleRepresentation)
      Returns if aDoubleRepresentation represents a double value by parsing
      Parameters:
      aDoubleRepresentation - Double representation
      Returns:
      true: aDoubleRepresentation represents a double value, false: Otherwise

    • getNumberStringWithInitialZeros

      public String getNumberStringWithInitialZeros(int aNumber, int aResultStringLength)
      Returns number string with trailing zeros, i.e. 32 leads to "00032" with maximum string length of 5
      Parameters:
      aNumber - Positive number
      aResultStringLength - Length of result string
      Returns:
      Number string with trailing zeros or null if none could be created

    • getNumberfromNumberStringWithInitialZeros

      public int getNumberfromNumberStringWithInitialZeros(String aNumberStringWithInitialZeros)
      Returns number of number string that was created with getNumberStringWithInitialZeros()
      Parameters:
      aNumberStringWithInitialZeros - Number string with possible initial zeros
      Returns:
      Number of number string that was created with getNumberStringWithInitialZeros() or -1L if number could not be created

    • isIntegerValue

      public boolean isIntegerValue(String anIntegerRepresentation)
      Returns if anIntegerRepresentation represents an integer value by parsing
      Parameters:
      anIntegerRepresentation - Integer representation
      Returns:
      true: anIntegerRepresentation represents an integer value, false: Otherwise

    • sortStringArray

      public void sortStringArray(String[] aStringArray)
      Sorts a string array. If ALL single strings are integer value representations the array is sorted according ascending integer values.
      Parameters:
      aStringArray - String array to be sorted

    • compressIntoBase64String

      public String compressIntoBase64String(String aString)
      Comresses string into Base64 string that encodes the underlying compressed UTF-8 byte array. Can be decompressed with method StringUtilityMethods.decompressBase64String().
      Parameters:
      aString - String to be compressed
      Returns:
      Compressed Base64 string or null if string could not be compressed

    • decompressBase64String

      public String decompressBase64String(String aBase64String)
      Decompresses Base64 string that was compressed with method StringUtilityMethods.compressIntoBase64String()
      Parameters:
      aBase64String - Base64 string (result string of method StringUtilityMethods.compressIntoBase64String())
      Returns:
      Decompressed string or null if string could not be decompressed

    • getFirstToken

      public String getFirstToken(String aString)
      Returns first token of a string with (white)space separated tokens.
      Parameters:
      aString - String with (white)space separated tokens
      Returns:
      First token of a string with (white)space separated tokens or null if none can be found

    • getLastToken

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getAllTokens

      public String[] getAllTokens(String aString)

      Parameters:
      aString - String with (white)space separated tokens
      Returns:
      All tokens of a string with (white)space separated tokens or null if none can be found

    • getToken

      public String getToken(String aString, int aTokenIndex)
      Returns the token with specified index (starting at 0)
      Parameters:
      aString - String with (white)space separated tokens
      aTokenIndex - Index of token (starting at 0)
      Returns:
      Token at specified position or null if not available

    • replaceToken

      public String replaceToken(String aString, int aTokenIndex, String aTokenReplacement)
      Replaces the token with specified index (starting at 0) with the specified replacement
      Parameters:
      aString - String with (white)space separated tokens
      aTokenIndex - Index of token (starting at 0)
      aTokenReplacement - Replacement of token (if null/empty the original string is returned)
      Returns:
      String with replaced token or original string if token at specified index can not be replaced

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • replaceEnding

      public String replaceEnding(String aString, String anOldEnding, String aNewEnding)
      Replaces anOldEnding of the string with aNewEnding. NOTE: Check of old ending converts to lower case.
      Parameters:
      aString - String
      anOldEnding - Old ending
      aNewEnding - New Ending
      Returns:
      String with replacement or original string if replacement could not be performed

    • createStringWithLength

      public String createStringWithLength(int aLength, char aFillCharacter)
      Generates string with defined length filled with specified character
      Parameters:
      aLength - Length of string
      aFillCharacter - Character the string will be filled with
      Returns:
      String of defined length filled with specified character

    • createSortablePositiveIntegerRepresentation

      public String createSortablePositiveIntegerRepresentation(int aValue, int aMaximumValue)
      Generates a sortable integer representation, i.e. if value is 17 and maximum value is 1000 then "0017" is returned.
      Parameters:
      aValue - Value (must be greater/equal 0)
      aMaximumValue - Maximum value (must be greater/equal 0)
      Returns:
      Sortable integer representation of empty string if representation can not be created

    • replaceSpaceByUnderscore

      public String replaceSpaceByUnderscore(String aText)
      Replaces every space character in aText by an underscore
      Parameters:
      aText - Text
      Returns:
      Text with replacements

    • replaceSpaceByUnderscore

      public String[] replaceSpaceByUnderscore(String[] aTexts)
      Replaces every space character in aTexts by an underscore
      Parameters:
      aTexts - Text array
      Returns:
      Text array with replacements

    • replaceUnderscoreBySpace

      public String replaceUnderscoreBySpace(String aText)
      Replaces every underscore in aText by a space character
      Parameters:
      aText - Text
      Returns:
      Text with replacements

    • replaceUnderscoreBySpace

      public String[] replaceUnderscoreBySpace(String[] aTexts)
      Replaces every underscore in aTexts by a space character
      Parameters:
      aTexts - Text array
      Returns:
      Text array with replacements

    • getConcatenatedStringArrays

      public String[] getConcatenatedStringArrays(String[] aFirstStringArray, String[] aSecondStringArray)
      aFirstStringArray and aSecondStringArray are concatenated to a new returned string array
      Parameters:
      aFirstStringArray - First string array
      aSecondStringArray - Second string array
      Returns:
      String array that consists of aFirstStringArray and concatenated aSecondStringArray or null if concatenated array could not be created

    • addStringAtFirstIndex

      public String[] addStringAtFirstIndex(String[] aStringArray, String aStringForFirstPosition)
      Creates new string array with aStringForFirstPosition at index 0 and all strings of aStringArray above so that aStringArray[i] = newArray[i + 1]
      Parameters:
      aStringArray - String array
      aStringForFirstPosition - String for first position
      Returns:
      New string array with aStringForFirstPosition at index 0 and all strings of aStringArray above so that aStringArray[i] = newArray[i + 1]

    • addStringAndSort

      public String[] addStringAndSort(String[] aStringArray, String aStringToAdd)
      Creates new array with all strings of aStringArray and aStringToAdd. The new array is sorted.
      Parameters:
      aStringArray - String array
      aStringToAdd - String to add
      Returns:
      Sorted new string array with aStringToAdd included

    • concatenateStringsWithSpace

      public String concatenateStringsWithSpace(String[] aStringArray)
      Concatenates strings of string array with a single space character
      Parameters:
      aStringArray - Contains strings to be concatenated
      Returns:
      Result string with concatenated strings separated by single space character or null if strings could not be concatenated

    • readJaggedStringArrayPartFromLineList

      public String[][] readJaggedStringArrayPartFromLineList(LinkedList<String> aLineList, String aCommentLinePrefix, String aSectionTag)
      Reads jagged string array from specified section of line list. Each line is split after one or more whitespace characters.
      Parameters:
      aLineList - Line list (may be null then null is returned)
      aCommentLinePrefix - Prefix of comment line to ignore (may be null/empty)
      aSectionTag - Section tag (if null/empty then null is returned)
      Returns:
      Jagged string array from specified section of line list or null if jagged string array could not be read

    • getFirstProteinBackboneForceIndex

      public String getFirstProteinBackboneForceIndex(String aLine)
      Returns first protein distance force index in aLine, e.g. aLine = "1 myParticle 23 1.000 2.000 3.000" returns "23" NOTE: No checks are performed for string 23
      Parameters:
      aLine - Line with possible protein distance force index
      Returns:
      First protein distance force index or null if none is found

    • replaceFirstProteinBackboneForceIndex

      public String replaceFirstProteinBackboneForceIndex(String aLine, String aReplacement)
      Replaces first protein distance force index in aLine with aReplacement e.g. aLine = "1 myParticle 23 1.000 2.000 3.000" returns "23" and aReplacement = "53" lead to result "1 myParticle 53 1.000 2.000 3.000" NOTE: No checks are performed for string 23
      Parameters:
      aLine - Line with possible protein distance force index
      aReplacement - Replacement
      Returns:
      Line with possible replacement
